page.title: 11TRANSPORT:CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: There are lots of kinds of transport that come to or through our area. There is a train track running through the block but although it carries passenger trains as well as goods trains there has not been a station in the block since the 1960's. The track is quite busy with a train at least every 15mins. Buses are the only public transport in the villages and they run every hour to Lincoln until about 7.00pm. The bus service is not well used and about 85% of people travel to and from work by car or motorbike.We estimate that 97% of households have a motorcar and many teenagers have motorbikes. Due to the R.A.F. aeroplanes are common in the area including the { Red Arrows.} M.BAILEY
